titles.title: Authorizing the use of the Capitol Grounds for a bike rodeo to be conducted by the Earth Force Youth Bike Summit.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Mr. LaTourette asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on Rules and Administration.
Senate Committee on Rules and Administration discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 5/9/2000--Passed Senate amended. Permits the Earth Force Youth Bike Summit, subject to specified conditions, to sponsor a bike rodeo on the Capitol grounds on May 10, 2000.Prohibits any person from representing that this resolution or any activity carried out under it in any way constitutes approval or endorsement by the Federal Government of any person or any product or service.Requires the Architect of the Capitol and the Capitol Police Board to enter into an agreement with the sponsor and other participants, which among other things shall: (1) specifically prohibit the use of any photograph taken at the event for a commercial purpose; and (2) provide for the imposition of financial penalties if any violations of the agreement occur.
